verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the first month of the second year after they were come out of the land of Egypt, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the first month of the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai during the 1st month of the 2nd year after the Israelites had left Egypt. He said,

verses.kjv: Let the children of Israel also keep the passover at his appointed season.
verses.web: “Let the children of Israel keep the Passover in its appointed season.
verses.ct: "The Israelites must celebrate the Passover at its appointed time.

verses.kjv: In the fourteenth day of this month, at even, ye shall keep it in his appointed season: according to all the rites of it, and according to all the ceremonies thereof, shall ye keep it.
verses.web: On the fourteenth day of this month, at evening, you shall keep it in its appointed season. You shall keep it according to all its statutes and according to all its ordinances.”
verses.ct: On the 14th day of this month, at twilight, you are to observe it at its appointed time. Follow every rule and regulation that goes with it."

verses.kjv: And Moses spake unto the children of Israel, that they should keep the passover.
verses.web: Moses told the children of Israel that they should keep the Passover.
verses.ct: So Moses told the Israelites to celebrate the Passover.

verses.kjv: And they kept the passover on the fourteenth day of the first month at even in the wilderness of Sinai: according to all that the LORD commanded Moses, so did the children of Israel.
verses.web: They kept the Passover in the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month at evening, in the wilderness of Sinai. According to all that LORD commanded Moses, so the children of Israel did.
verses.ct: They celebrated it on the 14th day of the 1st month at twilight in the wilderness of Sinai. The Israelites did everything exactly as the LORD had commanded Moses.

verses.kjv: And there were certain men, who were defiled by the dead body of a man, that they could not keep the passover on that day: and they came before Moses and before Aaron on that day:
verses.web: There were certain men, who were unclean because of the dead body of a man, so that they could not keep the Passover on that day, and they came before Moses and Aaron on that day.
verses.ct: But some men had become ceremonially unclean from contact with a dead body and couldn't celebrate the Passover on that day. They came to Moses and Aaron

verses.kjv: And those men said unto him, We are defiled by the dead body of a man: wherefore are we kept back, that we may not offer an offering of the LORD in his appointed season among the children of Israel?
verses.web: Those men said to him, “We are unclean because of the dead body of a man. Why are we kept back, that we may not offer the offering of LORD in its appointed season among the children of Israel?”
verses.ct: and said, "We are unclean because we touched a dead body. Why should we be excluded from presenting the LORD's offering at its appointed time along with the rest of Israel?"

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto them, Stand still, and I will hear what the LORD will command concerning you.
verses.web: Moses answered them, “Wait, that I may hear what LORD will command concerning you.”
verses.ct: Moses told them, "Wait here while I find out what the LORD commands about your situation."

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, If any man of you or of your posterity shall be unclean by reason of a dead body, or be in a journey afar off, yet he shall keep the passover unto the LORD.
verses.web: “Say to the children of Israel, ‘If any man of you or of your generations is unclean by reason of a dead body, or is on a journey far away, he shall still keep the Passover to LORD.
verses.ct: "Tell the Israelites: 'If any of you or your descendants become unclean from contact with a dead body, or are away on a long journey, you may still celebrate the Passover to the LORD.

verses.kjv: The fourteenth day of the second month at even they shall keep it, and eat it with unleavened bread and bitter herbs.
verses.web: In the second month, on the fourteenth day at evening they shall keep it; they shall eat it with unleavened bread and bitter herbs.
verses.ct: You must observe it on the 14th day of the 2nd month at twilight. Eat it with unleavened bread and bitter herbs.

verses.kjv: They shall leave none of it unto the morning, nor break any bone of it: according to all the ordinances of the passover they shall keep it.
verses.web: They shall leave none of it until the morning, nor break a bone of it. According to all the statute of the Passover they shall keep it.
verses.ct: Don't leave any of it until morning, and don't break any of its bones. Follow all the regulations of the Passover when you observe it.

verses.kjv: But the man that is clean, and is not in a journey, and forbeareth to keep the passover, even the same soul shall be cut off from among his people: because he brought not the offering of the LORD in his appointed season, that man shall bear his sin.
verses.web: But the man who is clean, and is not on a journey, and fails to keep the Passover, that soul shall be cut off from his people. Because he didn’t offer the offering of LORD in its appointed season, that man shall bear his sin.
verses.ct: But anyone who is clean and not on a journey and still fails to celebrate the Passover — that soul must be cut off from his people. Because he did not present the LORD's offering at its appointed time, that man will bear the consequences of his sin.

verses.kjv: And if a stranger shall sojourn among you, and will keep the passover unto the LORD; according to the ordinance of the passover, and according to the manner thereof, so shall he do: ye shall have one ordinance, both for the stranger, and for him that was born in the land.
verses.web: “ ‘If a foreigner lives among you, and desires to keep the Passover to LORD, then he shall do so according to the statute of the Passover, and according to its ordinance. You shall have one statute, both for the foreigner, and for him who is born in the land.’ ”
verses.ct: If a foreigner living among you wants to celebrate the Passover to the LORD, he must follow the same rules and regulations. There is one law for everyone — both the foreigner and the native-born.'"

verses.kjv: And on the day that the tabernacle was reared up the cloud covered the tabernacle, namely, the tent of the testimony: and at even there was upon the tabernacle as it were the appearance of fire, until the morning.
verses.web: On the day that the tabernacle was raised up, the cloud covered the tabernacle, even the Tent of the Testimony. At evening it was over the tabernacle, as it were the appearance of fire, until morning.
verses.ct: On the day the tabernacle was set up, a cloud covered it — specifically the tent that housed the tablets of the covenant. That evening, what looked like fire appeared over the tabernacle and stayed until morning.

verses.kjv: So it was alway: the cloud covered it by day, and the appearance of fire by night.
verses.web: So it was continually. The cloud covered it, and the appearance of fire by night.
verses.ct: This was the ongoing pattern: the cloud covered it during the day, and at night it looked like fire.

verses.kjv: And when the cloud was taken up from the tabernacle, then after that the children of Israel journeyed: and in the place where the cloud abode, there the children of Israel pitched their tents.
verses.web: Whenever the cloud was taken up from over the Tent, then after that the children of Israel traveled; and in the place where the cloud remained, there the children of Israel encamped.
verses.ct: Whenever the cloud lifted from above the tent, the Israelites would break camp and move out. Wherever the cloud settled, that's where the Israelites would set up camp.

verses.kjv: At the commandment of the LORD the children of Israel journeyed, and at the commandment of the LORD they pitched: as long as the cloud abode upon the tabernacle they rested in their tents.
verses.web: At the commandment of LORD, the children of Israel traveled, and at the commandment of LORD they encamped. As long as the cloud remained on the tabernacle they remained encamped.
verses.ct: The Israelites moved when the LORD commanded and stopped when the LORD commanded. As long as the cloud rested over the tabernacle, they stayed in their tents.

verses.kjv: And when the cloud tarried long upon the tabernacle many days, then the children of Israel kept the charge of the LORD, and journeyed not.
verses.web: When the cloud stayed on the tabernacle many days, then the children of Israel kept LORD’s command, and didn’t travel.
verses.ct: When the cloud lingered over the tabernacle for many days, the Israelites obeyed the LORD's command and did not travel.

verses.kjv: And so it was, when the cloud was a few days upon the tabernacle; according to the commandment of the LORD they abode in their tents, and according to the commandment of the LORD they journeyed.
verses.web: Sometimes the cloud was a few days on the tabernacle; then according to the commandment of LORD they remained encamped, and according to the commandment of LORD they traveled.
verses.ct: Sometimes the cloud stayed over the tabernacle for only a few days. When the LORD commanded, they stayed in camp; when the LORD commanded, they moved on.

verses.kjv: And so it was, when the cloud abode from even unto the morning, and that the cloud was taken up in the morning, then they journeyed: whether it was by day or by night that the cloud was taken up, they journeyed.
verses.web: Sometimes the cloud was from evening until morning; and when the cloud was taken up in the morning, they traveled; or by day and by night, when the cloud was taken up, they traveled.
verses.ct: Sometimes the cloud stayed only from evening until morning. When it lifted in the morning, they set out. Whether the cloud lifted during the day or at night, they moved whenever it rose.

verses.kjv: Or whether it were two days, or a month, or a year, that the cloud tarried upon the tabernacle, remaining thereon, the children of Israel abode in their tents, and journeyed not: but when it was taken up, they journeyed.
verses.web: Whether it was two days, or a month, or a year that the cloud stayed on the tabernacle, remaining on it, the children of Israel remained encamped, and didn’t travel; but when it was taken up, they traveled.
verses.ct: Whether the cloud remained over the tabernacle for 2 days, a month, or even a year, the Israelites stayed in camp and didn't travel. But the moment it lifted, they set out.

verses.kjv: At the commandment of the LORD they rested in the tents, and at the commandment of the LORD they journeyed: they kept the charge of the LORD, at the commandment of the LORD by the hand of Moses.
verses.web: At the commandment of LORD they encamped, and at the commandment of LORD they traveled. They kept LORD’s command, at the commandment of LORD by Moses.
verses.ct: They camped when the LORD commanded and traveled when the LORD commanded. They followed the LORD's instructions, given through Moses.
